text: Harold Gregory "Hal" Moore Jr. (February 13, 1922 - February 10, 2017) was a lieutenant general in the United States Army. He was also an author. Moore was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross, which is the second highest military honor of the United States Army. Moore was born in Bardstown, Kentucky. He graduated from the Military Academy in 1945. He was the first of his class to be promoted to brigadier general, major general, and lieutenant general. He fought during the Korean War and Vietnam War. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American military personnel of the Korean War Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Military people from Kentucky
title: Hal Moore
